snippet: The world would be a better place if we were as tough-minded in how we donate money as in how we make it.
abstract: Nicholas Kristof Op-Ed column praises Wall Street trader Matt Wage, who deliberately chose career in finance in order to contribute more to charity; says Wage exemplifies movement called 'effective altruism,' aimed at rigorously making maximum difference in world; cites GiveWell's top recommendations for finding cost-effective charities that can have maximum transformative impact on society.
lead_paragraph: The world would be a better place if we were as tough-minded in how we donate money as in how we make it.
